definition: to bear/to endure/to tolerate/to restrain oneself

sentences.english: "What level of risk can be considered tolerable?
sentences.chinese: “什么程度的危险能被视为可以容忍？”

sentences.english: The catalytic system has excellent functional group tolerance.
sentences.chinese: 该体系具有较好的官能团容忍性。

sentences.english: What Chinese cannot bear most is to be refused or to lose face.
sentences.chinese: 中国人认为最不能容忍的事情是受到拒绝和不给面子。

sentences.english: My mother is very honest she cannot stand for lying of any kind.
sentences.chinese: 我的很成实，她不能容忍一点的谎言。

sentences.english: He said the situation for civilians has become intolerable.
sentences.chinese: 他说，平民百姓的处境已经到了不能容忍的地步。

sentences.english: The fifth time when she forbore for weakness, and attributed her patience to.
sentences.chinese: 第五次是她容忍了软弱，而把她的忍受称为坚强。

sentences.english: The calcium tolerance of phosphonic acid is lower than polymer type scale inhibitors.
sentences.chinese: 有机膦酸的钙容忍度低于聚合物防垢剂。

sentences.english: He won't brook any criticism of his work.
sentences.chinese: 他不容忍对他工作的任何批评。

sentences.english: When the city was feeling strong, the quirky philosopher could be tolerated.
sentences.chinese: 当这城市强盛时，他可以容忍这样一个怪异的哲学家。

sentences.english: I can’t endure the leisured man’s measures for the treasures in the treasury.
sentences.chinese: 我不能容忍那个悠闲男子对金库财宝采取的措施。

sentences.english: First, I will not tolerate harassment or any other form of misconduct.
sentences.chinese: 首先，我不能容忍骚扰或任何其它形式的不正当行为。

sentences.english: A maximum tolerance is usually given by your client.
sentences.chinese: 最高可容忍的是通常由您的客户。

sentences.english: D. Giraffe- patience, never give up on you.
sentences.chinese: 你喜欢容忍耐心的方式，从不放弃对你的追求。

sentences.english: His device can tolerate noise levels that are as large as the input signal itself (Applied Physics Letters, DOI: 10.1063/1.3302457).
sentences.chinese: 他的设备可以容忍和输入一样大的噪音。

sentences.english: But he makes clear price gouging will not be tolerated.
sentences.chinese: 但他清楚地表示，哄抬油价的行为是绝不能容忍的。

sentences.english: They will love you more for your gentleness and forbearing spirit.
sentences.chinese: 他们将会更爱你的温柔和容忍的精神。

definition: excessively tolerant/to overindulge (sb)/overly conciliatory/to seek appeasement at any price
to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
see 恣意妄為|恣意妄为[zi4 yi4 wang4 wei2]

pinyin: yi1 er2 zai4 , zai4 er2 san1

definition: to yield/to adapt to/to accommodate to (sth)
to shield (a miscreant) from punishment, criticism etc/to take sb's side
to ignore/to neglect/to treat with contempt
to endure/to bear with/to exercise patience/to restrain oneself/patience/endurance
to sit and watch, but remain indifferent (idiom)
